_description: Auto Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating car/auto insurance pages

data.state_laws_summary: California follows a tort system requiring liability coverage
data.intro_content: California drivers pay an average of $1,500/year for auto insurance. Understanding state requirements helps you find the best coverage.
data.requirements_content: California requires minimum liability coverage of 15/30/5. This covers bodily injury and property damage you cause to others.

cost_factors.description: Better credit means lower rates in CA

faqs.question: What is minimum auto insurance in California?
faqs.answer: California requires 15/30/5 liability coverage: $15,000 per person, $30,000 per accident, $5,000 property damage.

faqs.question: How much does car insurance cost in California?
faqs.answer: The average is $1,500/year, but rates vary based on your driving record, age, location, and vehicle.

data.state_laws_summary: Texas requires higher minimum liability than most states
data.intro_content: Texas requires higher minimum coverage than many states. Houston drivers face unique challenges including traffic congestion and weather risks.
data.requirements_content: Texas mandates 30/60/25 liability coverage, providing better protection than the minimum required in most states.

cost_factors.description: Hail and flooding can damage vehicles

discounts.name: Multi-Policy Bundle
discounts.description: Combine auto with home or renters

faqs.question: What are Texas auto insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Texas requires 30/60/25 liability coverage, higher than many other states.
